title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 September 2014 - XWiki

14:01 <cjd> vmassol: the fix should look something like    PID=$$ ; ( wait $PID ; rm $LOCKFILE ) & <-- that part spawns a new bash process  
14:01 <cjd> and then    exec java .....  
14:01 <cjd> as opposed to just java ...  
14:02 <cjd> then java is in the forground process, and therefor takes the pid from the shell, which allows you to know the pid in advance...  
14:02 <cjd> oh right, you can't actually use wait, the script I wrote uses kill -0 in a loop  
14:03 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <vmassol> cjd: ok thanks, will try to find your ezcrypt link (in a meeting now)  
14:11 <cjd> ok  
14:16 <Denis> has quit  
14:16 <gdelhumeau> I am debbuging http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg-6.2.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/MacroTest/testDoubleClickToEditMacro/  
14:19 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: ok. Most likely a timing issue.  
14:19 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <vmassol> has quit  
14:27 <gdelhumeau> how long is wait in selenium-1 ?  
14:27 <gdelhumeau> +a wait  
14:29 <ClemensR> I think the tests set this somewhere, to 10 seconds, iirc  
14:31 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <ClemensR> ah, no, that was for platform tests. tests in xwiki-enterprise might be a different issue  
14:38 <polx> has quit  
14:40 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <mflorea> Enygma`: re XWIKI-11055  
14:44 <mflorea> there is already -DpatternMethod=doSomething  
14:44 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:46 <Enygma`> mflorea: on selenium2 tests?  
14:46 <Enygma`> -DpatternMethod is only available on selenium1 tests  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> but you can do -Dpattern=Class#method  
14:47 <Enygma`> no, you can`t  
14:47 <Enygma`> it is documented, but it is not working or implemented that way  
14:47 <Enygma`> see my commit  
14:48 <Enygma`> with XWIKI-11055 you have a more flexible pattern syntax, so you can do whatever you want there. See the issue or the documentation of XWikiExecutorTestMethodFilter  
14:48 <mflorea> I see, it's not that clear from the issue title. You needed more flexibility than what is provided by -Dtest  
14:48 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <Enygma`> -Dtest does not work well on XWiki`s tests because it overwrites AllTests (suite) and directly calls the asked for test  
14:58 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:06 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: you should porbably go ahead and push it on stable-6.2.x as well  
15:07 <gdelhumeau> even if I'm not reallu sure it will fix the thing?  
15:07 <gdelhumeau> yes, let's try to save some time  
15:10 <msmeria> has quit  
15:11 <Enygma`> yes, that was my logic as well  
15:12 <Enygma`> I see no harm in your modification  
15:17 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:23 <Enygma`> cool  
15:23 <Enygma`> based on this http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/41/testReport/  
15:24 <Enygma`> I can now run this build command:  
15:24 <gdelhumeau> getDriver().findElement(By.id(id)).click(); should wait for the element before clicking, right?  
15:24 <Enygma`> xwiki-enterprise-test-ui]$ mvn clean install -Plegacy,integration-tests,jetty,hsqldb,firefox -e -U -Dpattern="org.xwiki.test.ui.EditObjectsTest#testChangeMultiselectProperty|org.xwiki.test.ui.LoginTest#testRedirectBackAfterLogin|org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes.AppsLiveTableTest#testDeleteApplication|org.xwiki.test.ui.SectionTest#testSectionEditInWikiEditorWhenSyntax2x|org.xwiki.test.ui.scheduler.SchedulerTest#testJobActions"  
15:24 <Inge-> AAAaaaaaah! My eyes!  
15:24 <Enygma`> Results :  
15:25 <Enygma`> and conclude that they are flickering tests that do not affect my release process  
15:26 <Enygma`> Inge-: wear sun glasses :)  
15:26 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: don`t have enough experience with selenium tests to say...  
15:27 <Enygma`> probably depends on what you do before that  
15:27 <OSIMasson> has quit  
15:27 <vmassol> findElement always wait  
15:28 <vmassol> and click also wait for the new page to be loaded  
15:28 <gdelhumeau> then I don't understand  
15:28 <gdelhumeau> hhm, and if I click on something that does not load a new page, it is ok?  
15:28 <vmassol> then it doesn't wait  
15:28 <vmassol> see the javadoc for click()  
15:28 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:29 <Enygma`> basically, it does not cover javascript stuff  
15:29 <gdelhumeau> so there is nothing wrong here from the code PoV: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/SectionTest/testSectionSaveDoesNotOverwriteTheWholeContentWhenSyntax20/  
15:29 <Enygma`> just form submits and <a> elements  
15:29 <vmassol> "Clicks on a link, button, checkbox or radio button. If the click action causes a new page to load (like a link usually does), call waitForPageToLoad."  
15:29 <vmassol> (from the javadoc)  
15:29 <gdelhumeau> I do "getDriver().findElement(By.id(id)).click();", so it must wait for the element to be visible  
15:30 <vmassol> (http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/docs/api/java/index.html?overview-summary.html)  
15:30 <gdelhumeau> and it should not take 10seconds to display a bootstrap menu with javascript  
15:30 <vmassol> yes findElement always does a wait  
15:30 <Enygma`> maybe it finds it in the dom but it is not visible  
15:30 <Enygma`> so maybe wait for element to be visible?  
15:31 <gdelhumeau> hmm good idea  
15:31 <gdelhumeau> let's do it  
15:31 <vmassol> "Find the first http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/docs/api/java/org/openqa/selenium/WebElement.html using the given method. This method is affected by the 'implicit wait' times in force at the time of execution. The findElement(..) invocation will return a matching row, or try again repeatedly until the configured timeout is reached. findElement should not be used to look for non-present elements, use http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> so I must remember: findElement does not mean that the element is visible  
15:34 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: that was the problem after all?  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> I don't reproduce locally  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> so I can't say  
15:34 <Enygma`> ok  
15:35 <Enygma`> vmassol: maybe we could upgrade the jenkins scriptler that detects false positives to relaunch the job if it's an "XWiki instance already running" problem  
15:35 <Enygma`> wdyt?  
15:35 <vmassol> Enygma`: you know how to do that?  
15:36 <Enygma`> would it be that hard?  
15:36 <vmassol> no idea  
15:36 <vmassol> not sure it's a good idea though  
15:36 <vmassol> if an xwiki is already running then why would it work the second time without any intervention?  
15:37 <Enygma`> curiously enough, it seems that it works like that  
15:37 <vmassol> in any case I don't know how to do it without reearching it  
15:37 <vmassol> I'd rather we understand the problem :)  
15:37 <vmassol> I'm just worried that this would hide it a bit  
15:37 <Enygma`> I`m wondering if there is any diference between selenium 1 and selenium 2 tests that might be to blame for these xwiki instances  
15:37 <vmassol> possibly yes  
15:38 <vmassol> although I think they both use XWikiExecutor  
15:38 <Enygma`> so your start/stop script upgrades fixed selenium2 tests  
15:38 <Enygma`> but sel1 are still causing problems  
15:38 <vmassol> we need to check if sel1 uses XWikiEecutor  
15:38 <Enygma`> that sel2 tests fix when they execute  
15:38 <vmassol> if it does then it should work the sale  
15:38 <vmassol> \*same  
15:38 <Enygma`> k  
15:38 <vmassol> checking  
15:40 <vmassol> sel1 does use XWikiExecutor too  
15:44 <Enygma`> right, through XWikiTestSetup

16:21 <gdelhumeau> Good to know: on https://www.modern.ie/ you can download VM with Windows and Internet explorer from different version (IE 11, IE 10, IE9, IE8, etc...). Theses VMs are compatible with Linux  
16:21 <cjd> do they have kvm instances?  
16:21 <gdelhumeau> I see virtual box  
16:22 <cjd> myeah  
16:22 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: please cherry-pick https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ca0b6374663d638fcfe5377f2681869de3968b30 into stable-6.2.x  
16:23 <vmassol> yes it's cool, I've used that in the past  
16:23 <vmassol> quite large downloads  
16:24 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`: sure, I'm surprised I didn't  
16:24 <cjd> windows vista [  windows xp  [ windows 95  [  windows 3.1  [ dos ] ] ] ] ]  
16:24 <cjd> things get big after a while :)  
16:24 <Chuguniy> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`: actually it is: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c7d9ac6124bc247f0ea459d7925525f297f0cd22  
16:25 <EA> has joined #xwiki  
16:26 <Enygma`> hmm... I find it now as well  
16:26 <Enygma`> I think github had a hickup at displaying commit history :)  
16:27 <EA> hello: are there any known issues with the XWiki Extension repo at the moment? upon subwiki creation, I hit Continue on the Distribution Wizard and the User Interface step just hangs (Spinning progress bar(  
16:28 <cjd> !ping  
16:28 <Enygma`> EA: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome seems to be responding and so does http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/  
16:28 <EA> yesterday I was able to create a second subwiki no problem. then maybe 2 hours later I tried to make a separate subwiki and i got the DW just hanging on XWiki Enterprise - UI - Wiki 6.0.1  
16:28 <Enygma`> make sure to check your logs  
16:28 <gdelhumeau> EA: it is not supposed to download the same XAR a second time  
16:30 <EA> gdelhumeau: so if I hit Later or Never on the DW I will get an empty subwiki  
16:30 <EA> is my only option to manually import the default set of pages?  
16:30 <gdelhumeau> when you do F5, what do you get?  
16:31 <EA> the same page with the DW progress wheel still spinning  
16:33 <EA> hmm, my logs do show something is wrong  
16:33 <EA> 2014-09-17 10:26:41,235 [<MY WEBSITE>/bin/view/WikiManager/CreateWiki] ERROR .o.i.DefaultObservationManager - Failed to send event [org.xwiki.bridge.event.WikiCreatedEvent@d324b766] to listener [org.xwiki.extension.xar.internal.handler.WikiEventListener@490c505b]  
16:33 <EA> java.lang.NullPointerException: null  
16:35 <tmortagne> EA: looks like http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11010  
16:36 <tmortagne> but that's before the DW  
16:36 <tmortagne> so it's not the cause of the DW being stuck  
16:36 <benoitc\_> has quit  
16:37 <EA> interesting. I created subwiki1 and then installed 2 extensions with “install on farm”  
16:37 <tmortagne> also as gdelhumeau said extension installed once are stored locally and not downloaded again  
16:37 <EA> then tried to create subwiki2 and am now having these errors  
16:38 <tmortagne> so usually resolve and download steps are super fast after you already installed an extension  
16:39 <tmortagne> what is the last log you have in the DW UI ?  
16:40 <tmortagne> when showing extension or progress details  
16:40 <EA> it would have been yesterday and i don’t have them saved unfortunately  
16:41 <tmortagne> ok  
16:41 <EA> from the main wiki’s admin page, the Check for updates on farm also hangs  
16:41 <Enygma`> vmassol: please add to development pain points: Trying to run a selenium test from the IDE when that test requires a classpath resource file. For some reason, the resource is never found in the test-resources classpath.  
16:43 <Denis> has quit  
16:45 <EA> @tmortagne: getting bin/jsx/Calendar/JQueryUI?language=en&defer=false warnings in the log. in regards to errors on line 9, specifically syntax errors and invalid returns.  
16:46 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
16:47 <vmassol> Enygma`: then add "Eclipse" to the pain point list because AFAIR it works fine in IDEA ;)  
16:47 <Enygma`> vmassol: begone with your proprietary sorcery! ;)  
16:47 <vmassol> proprietary?  
16:47 <tmortagne> it used to work well on Eclipse  
16:47 <benoitc\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:47 <vmassol> it's as open source as eclipse :)  
16:48 <cjd> IDEA is open source?  
16:48 <ClemensR> the warnings about jQueryUI are "ok" - the js-minimizer cannot compress the (already) compressed JS. should be unreleated to the problems with the DW  
16:48 <vmassol> sure  
16:48 <vmassol> (cjd)  
16:48 <vmassol> the community edition  
16:48 <tmortagne> Enygma`: sometime m2e miss some resource you should probably update and cleanup this project  
16:48 <vmassol> http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/features/editions\_comparison\_matrix.html  
16:48 <cjd> ahh ok, graceful degradation  
16:48 <tmortagne> but it did not happen since a long time for me  
16:48 <vmassol> it's actually very complete  
16:49 <cjd> is it what you use?  
16:49 <Enygma`> tmortagne: happens for pretty much all tests executed from the IDE that require a resource  
16:49 <vmassol> no because we have a license for the ultimate version  
16:50 <tmortagne> Enygma`: I have many test with resources that work well  
16:50 <tmortagne> all extension related test have resources  
16:51 <tmortagne> EA: you should have detailed live log for the "Check for updates" job too I think  
16:51 <Enygma`> vmassol: so it has a free community edition, but is it open source?  
16:51 <vmassol> I told you already  
16:51 <Enygma`> tmortagne: will probably contact you for more details on the Eclipse topic later  
16:51 <vmassol> http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/download/  
16:52 <vmassol> license is ASL2  
16:52 <tmortagne> Enygma`: note that in m2e stuff don't go to target/  
16:52 <tmortagne> they go to target-eclipse  
16:52 <Enygma`> tmortagne: yes, target-eclipse  
16:52 <vmassol> cjd= here http://www.jetbrains.org/  
16:52 <cjd> that's why apache license is bad, use GPLv3 for everything  
16:52 <vmassol> what?  
16:52 <vmassol> quite the opposite  
16:53 <cjd> do you think they pay the authors of the libraries they use when they sell licenses?  
16:53 <vmassol> how is that bad?  
16:53 <cjd> it's easy to sell stuff when you're selling someone else's stuff  
16:53 <tmortagne> Enygma`: running org.xwiki.extension.repository.local.DefaultLocalExtensionRepositoryTest with run as Junit test does not work for you ?  
16:53 <vmassol> why do you think people use the ASL?  
16:53 <tmortagne> in xwiki-commons-extension-api  
16:54 <cjd> same reason people goto casinos, haven't quite figured it out :)  
16:54 <tmortagne> (I always using "debug as" but I guess "run as" is the same)  
16:55 <Enygma`> cjd: you`re arguing that LGPL is bad as well.  
16:55 <cjd> yeah, I wouldn't do an LGPL project  
16:55 <vmassol> errr you forgot something  
16:55 <vmassol> you're doing one  
16:55 <Enygma`> vmassol: indeed, looks to be open source :)  
16:55 <vmassol> :)  
16:55 <cjd> GPLv3 and if you want to sell my work, you can give me a cut  
16:55 <Enygma`> still don`t like the community vs paid editions  
16:56 <Enygma`> tmortagne: testing  
16:56 <cjd> s/do/start/  
16:56 <Enygma`> cjd: you`ve doomed all open source libraries into oblivion :)  
16:56 <EA> tmortagne: only seeing in my log 2014-09-17 10:40:16,277 [https://<MY WEBSITE>/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=XWiki.ExtensionUpdater] WARN  o.x.v.i.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Deprecated usage of getter [com.xpn.xwiki.api.DeprecatedContext.getLocalUser] in @91,56  
16:57 <cjd> Enygma`: ?  
16:57 <EA> not detailed live log  
16:57 <vmassol> are we Friday? :)  
16:57 <tmortagne> EA: I'm not talking about system log  
16:57 <cjd> actually I take that back, AGPL > GPL  
16:57 <vmassol> cjd: we told you that you were only allowed to start trolls on Fridays!  
16:57 <tmortagne> all extension manager task have detailed log displayed in the UI and saved later  
16:58 <cjd> I totally didn't start this  
16:58 <vmassol> I started the eclipse vs idea troll, I accept that  
16:58 <tmortagne> EA: log you should see in the UI by clicking some show details button or something  
16:58 <vmassol> but you started the license one  
16:58 <EA> nothing - just spinning progress wheel and nothing finished/completed  
16:59 <cjd> keeping a lively open source community isn't easy :)(  
16:59 <tmortagne> EA: could you take some screenshot ?  
16:59 <EA> The text “Checking for updates…” appears, a spinning wheel spins, and a progress bar remains completely empty  
16:59 <ClemensR> has quit  
16:59 <vmassol> you just need a caleb in it! :)  
16:59 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:00 <EA> sure  
17:01 <cjd> I can talk once per minute  
17:01 <EA> errr… not familiar with Colloquy with inserting a screenshot. what is the best way to do it?  
17:01 <Enygma`> tmortagne: not sure where I should find DefaultLocalExtensionRepositoryTest  
17:01 <tmortagne> Enygma`: (04:53:46 PM) tmortagne: in xwiki-commons-extension-api  
17:02 <cjd> EA: there's no way to send screenshots over IRC, you'll have to upload them to an image hosting service and paste the link  
17:03 <Enygma`> tmortagne: well, those run, but they are regular unit tests. I am having problems with enterprise selenium tests  
17:03 <Enygma`> not sure why they are different, but they just refuse to properly read my test resources  
17:03 <tmortagne> they are unit tests too, it should not make much difference from classloader point of view  
17:04 <tmortagne> it must be something wrong in our test framework  
17:05 <EA> tmortagne: http://imgur.com/9InNUXS
